intro: Miconia morii, commonly known as the Hawaiian miconia, is a member of the Melastomataceae family. It is a shrub or small tree that can grow up to 6 meters in height. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, violet-pink flowers. It is native to the Hawaiian Islands and thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its aggressive growth, it is considered an invasive species in some regions.
